summary: The bill, titled the Stop China’s Continuous Purchase of Land Act, aims to restrict the purchase of U.S. agricultural land by certain foreign persons, particularly those from covered foreign countries, as defined by the State Department and including Russia. It prohibits states from receiving funds under specific federal programs unless they have laws in place restricting such land purchases and requiring reporting of existing holdings. The bill also mandates reports from the Secretary of Agriculture and the Comptroller General regarding the impact of the Act and foreign investment in agricultural land.
